Generic Kernels

Class Explicit Feature Map Kernel Parameters Factory Type
kerch.kernel.Linear \(\phi(x) = x\) \(k(x,y)=\phi(x)^\top\phi(y)\) None ’linear’
kerch.kernel.RBF \(k(x,y)=\exp\left(-\frac{\left\lVert x-y\right\rVert^2_2}{2\sigma^2}\right)\) sigma ’rbf’
kerch.kernel.Laplacian \(k(x,y)=\exp\left(-\frac{\left\lVert x-y\right\rVert_2}{2\sigma^2}\right)\) sigma ’laplacian’
kerch.kernel.Polynomial See documentation \(k(x,y) = \left(x^\top y + \beta\right)^\alpha\) alpha, beta ’polynomial’
kerch.kernel.Cosine \(\phi(x) = \frac{x}{\left\lVert x\right\rVert_2}\) \(k(x,y)=\phi(x)^\top\phi(y)\) None ’cosine’
kerch.kernel.Sigmoid \(k(x,y) = \sigma\left( a (x^\top y) + b \right)\) a, b ’sigmoid’
kerch.kernel.RFF See documentation \(k(x,y)=\phi(x)^\top\phi(y)\) num_weights, sigma ’rff’
kerch.kernel.Nystrom See documentation See documentation dim ’nystrom’

Network-Based Kernels

Class Explicit Feature Map Kernel Parameters Factory Type
kerch.kernel.ExplicitNN \(\phi(x) = NN\left(x\right)\) \(k(x,y)=\phi(x)^\top\phi(y)\) None ’explicit_nn’
kerch.kernel.ImplicitNN \(k(x,y) = NN\left( [x, y] \right).\) None ’implicit_nn’

Time Kernels

The idea behind time kernels is that time has the same local effect at all time, or in other words that the kernels are translational invariant. We typically consider the following kernels:

Class Explicit Feature Map Kernel Parameters Factory Type
kerch.kernel.Indicator See documentation lag, gamma ’indicator’
kerch.kernel.RBF \(k(x,y)=\exp\left(-\frac{\left\lVert x-y\right\rVert^2_2}{2\sigma^2}\right)\) sigma ’rbf’
kerch.kernel.Hat See documentation lag ’hat’

Statistical Kernels

Class Explicit Feature Map Kernel Parameters Factory Type
kerch.kernel.Uniform \(k(x,y)=1 \text{ for } \frac{d(x,y)}{\sigma} \leq 1\) sigma, distance ’uniform’
kerch.kernel.Triangular \(k(x,y)=1 - \frac{d(x,y)}{\sigma} \text{ for } \frac{d(x,y)}{\sigma} \leq 1\) sigma, distance ’triangular’
kerch.kernel.Epanechnikov \(k(x,y)=1 - \left(\frac{d(x,y)}{\sigma}\right)^2 \text{ for } \frac{d(x,y)}{\sigma} \leq 1\) sigma, distance ’epanechnikov’
kerch.kernel.Quartic \(k(x,y)= \left(1 - \left(\frac{d(x,y)}{\sigma}\right)^2\right)^2 \text{ for } \frac{d(x,y)}{\sigma} \leq 1\) sigma, distance ’quartic’
kerch.kernel.Triweight \(k(x,y)= \left(1 - \left(\frac{d(x,y)}{\sigma}\right)^2\right)^3 \text{ for } \frac{d(x,y)}{\sigma} \leq 1\) sigma, distance ’triweight’
kerch.kernel.Tricube \(k(x,y)= \left(1 - \left|\frac{d(x,y)}{\sigma}\right|^3\right)^3 \text{ for } \frac{d(x,y)}{\sigma} \leq 1\) sigma, distance ’tricube’
kerch.kernel.Exponential \(k(x,y)= \exp\left(-\frac{d(x,y)}{\sigma}\right)\) sigma, distance, squared ’exponential’
kerch.kernel.Logistic \(k(x,y)= \frac{4}{\exp\left(d(x,y)/\sigma\right) + 2 + \exp\left(-d(x,y)/\sigma\right)}\) sigma, distance ’logistic’
kerch.kernel.Silverman \(k(x,y)= \exp\left(-\frac{d(x,y)}{\sqrt{2}\sigma}\right)\sin\left(\frac{d(x,y)}{\sqrt{2}\sigma} + \frac{\pi}{4}\right)\) sigma, distance ’silverman’

Vision Kernels

Class Explicit Feature Map Kernel Parameters Factory Type
kerch.kernel.AdditiveChi2 \(k(x,y) = \sum_i \frac{2x_i y_i}{x_i + y_i}\) None ’additive_chi_2’
kerch.kernel.SkewedChi2 \(k(x,y) = \prod_i \frac{2\sqrt{x_i+p} \sqrt{y_i+p}}{x_i + y_i + 2}\) p ’skewed_chi_2’

Abstract Kernels

Class Explicit Feature Map Kernel Parameters Factory Type
Exponential _dist() sigma N/A
Explicit _explicit() \(k(x,y)=\phi(x)^\top\phi(y)\) None N/A
Implicit _implicit() None N/A
Kernel _explicit() _implicit() None N/A
